page.title: 12SPECIAL EDUCATION IN WIDNES
page.content: There are 4 special education schools in Widnes.{Greenfield E.S.N. school was opened in{1961.}It has 108 pupils aged from 5 to 16. { Chesnut Lodge school}was built in {1972.}Some of the children are in wheelchairs.They come from a wide area around Widnes.There are a lot of staff including physiotheropists and nurses. The school has its own swimming pool. { Oakfield School}has two{Special Needs {Units}attached to it.One for nursery and infant children,the other for 24 junior children.Oakfield also has a swimming pool used by all local schools. { Brookfield school}moved into a new building in{1981}next to Crow Wood hospital where some of the childen live.They have their calipers put on in the classroom.They swim at the Kingsway Leisure Centre.
